00056 // ---- Implementation of inlined methods ----
00057       
00058 inline int 
00059 MathUtility::getNbrBitsGeneric( uint32 x )
00060 {
00061 
00062    int r = 32;
00063    
00064    if (x == 0)
00065       return 1; // 1 bit is needed also for 0...
00066    if (!(x & 0xffff0000u)) {
00067       x <<= 16;
00068       r -= 16;
00069    }
00070    if (!(x & 0xff000000u)) {
00071       x <<= 8;
00072       r -= 8;
00073    }
00074    if (!(x & 0xf0000000u)) {
00075       x <<= 4;
00076       r -= 4;
00077    }
00078    if (!(x & 0xc0000000u)) {
00079       x <<= 2;
00080       r -= 2;
00081    }
00082    if (!(x & 0x80000000u)) {
00083       x <<= 1;
00084       r -= 1;
00085    }
00086    return r;
00087 }
00088 
00089 inline int 
00090 MathUtility::getNbrBitsSignedGeneric( int x )
00091 {
00092    // Ugly fix. Pretend that one bit is needed for the value 0.
00093    if ( x == 0 ) {
00094       return 1;
00095    }
00096 
00097    if ( x < 0 ) { 
00098       x = -x;
00099    }
00100    return getNbrBitsGeneric( uint32( x ) ) + 1;
00101 }
00102 
00103 inline int
00104 MathUtility::getNbrBits( uint32 value )
00105 {
00106    // Removed the use of log and ceil since that didn't work
00107    // when compiling with optimizations. The generic version is
00108    // probably faster anyway.
00109    return getNbrBitsGeneric( value );
00110 }

00116    // when compiling with optimizations. The generic version is
00117    // probably faster anyway.
00118    return getNbrBitsSignedGeneric( signedValue );
00119 }
